description:
This app is great for haveing granual control over what apps are allowed to do on the network side. The GUI is very intuitive unlike those CLI firewall tools, and you get a really good breakdown of everything going on.

They also provide default block-lists that are supposed to block ads and trackers on the network level, however there are too many enabled by default and it breaks a LOT of websites. For example, facebook.com is completely blocked.

After you turn that off and use a custom DNS like ControlD or NextDNS, you're set.
summary: Everything is awesome except the default blocklists
Excellent application, should be in fedora's repos

description: An really great app for privacy that is easy to use.

+ VPN alternative that's superior to regular VPNs for security and privacy
+ Easy to use
+ FREE extended firewall
summary: The best extended firewall and a powerful, modernised VPN upgrade!

description: it removed my vpn and works only if i give them all access to my computer and gets complete controll of my fedora and it is only free after incremental small payments first and you have to give them you data for "tax purposes" this is not privacy, i have deinstalled it
Hopefully this will be a flatpak or snap in the future to make it more accessible to users. Works flawlessly with NextDNS for a fully customized private DNS experience.
